Replying to @SatlokChannel 8. Lunar and Martian Exploration: Humanity’s Next Steps The Moon and Mars are at the center of future exploration. NASA’s Artemis program aims to return humans to the Moon, establish a lunar base, and prepare for Mars missions. Chandrayaan-3 and China’s Chang’e program have provided crucial insights into lunar resources. On Mars, Perseverance is searching for past life, while the Mars Sample Return mission plans to bring Martian soil back to Earth. These missions will lay the groundwork for human settlements beyond Earth, shaping the future of space exploration. Prathamesh Anand @Prathamesh56451 Home 1 113 127 434 Brian Basson @BassonBrain·Jan 8 Explore NEWS: @NASA emphasizes role of the moon as testbed for future human Mars missions. 2 Notifications While Elon Musk suggests he is interested in going directly to Mars, NASA experts argue that lunar missions are essential before attempting any Messages human expeditions to the Red Planet. "The moon is an outstanding testbed that we have for development of Grok Mars," said Michael Chappell, part of the agency’s Mars Architecture Team. "To me, it’s pretty critical to go back to the moon before we go on to Mars." Lists NASA engineers working on the agency’s architecture for human Mars missions said during a panel at the AIAA SciTech Forum on Jan. 7 that they were skeptical crewed missions to Mars of any kind —not specifically Bookmarks addressing Musk’s comments — could be successful without first demonstrating technologies on the moon. Jobs The biggest issue, he said, is keeping people alive and well on such missions. “We have a substantial gap in knowledge about the health impacts of long-duration space travel, which is going to be necessary for a Communities trip to Mars,” he said, as well as how people will interact with such vehicles. “All these things we can learn a lot more quickly on the moon and in Premium cislunar space.” Dayna Ise of NASA’s Mars Campaign Office said that the agency is gaining Verified Orgs experience in life support systems needed for a Mars transit from the International Space Station, but work there and on the moon will be needed for some aspects of a Mars mission, like logistics. Profile “There is going to be no resupply for a Mars mission,” she said, unlike regular resupply missions to the ISS. “On the moon, we will learn a lot More about resupply and how we do logistics for lunar missions, but then all of that we have to leverage to figure out how to do a mission with no resupply.” Post Source: SpaceNews, image: NASA

What happened on February 18! In 2021, NASA’s Perseverance rover successfully landed in Jezero Crater on Mars as part of the Mars 2020 mission. Designed to search for signs of ancient life, collect soil samples, and test oxygen production for future human missions, Perseverance carried the Ingenuity helicopter, the first aircraft to fly on another planet. Its advanced instruments, including SHERLOC and MOXIE, aid in studying Mars’ geology and atmosphere, paving the way for future exploration.
